instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2337: What is A2337? A2337 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2020 M1 with EMC 3598, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02016..
definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
Reference Only: REF1137

History on the board, I think the touch bar could have fried some things but I am not certain as I have worked on this a while back, and am back at it again.

I can see picture externally on a display, and also on the LCD screen, just no backlight.
<SIGNAL>LPDP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> does not go high.
I have replaced: QP800, QP801, UP800. CP600.
DP800 pin K gets .048, A slowly drops but at .048 and still dropping.
I dont know what else to do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>LPDP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> [U]must[/U] be high to enable internal video.
You've probably measured in wrong point.

Did you test with known good LCD assembly?
Do NOT use Intel screen for test; you may kill the M1 processor.

Do you get <SIGNAL>5V_SW_LCD_CONN</SIGNAL>?
Check for correct <SIGNAL>1V8_AON</SIGNAL> at UC120 output.

BTW, all voltage checkings in backlight area must be done with LCD connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 99999, member: 682"]
<SIGNAL>LPDP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> [U]must[/U] be high to enable internal video.
[/QUOTE]
I went back and checked RP611 Pin 1 and there is definetly no voltage. I tested on my external monitor again and it recieves a signal but never any video.
I do believe I hooked up one of the intel displays. Fried?
When I tried to turn the computer on, the fan spins up real fast.
